intro: Agelanthus gilgii, commonly known as the Gilgii agelanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This species is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
